subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: Filial Piety: Why You Obey Your Parents
description: A quick win: understand Filial Piety: Why You Obey Your Parents.

hook.text: In Confucian culture, disobeying your parents is worse than breaking the law. Family loyalty is society's foundation.

buildup.text: Filial piety (xiao) means devotion to parents above all. It includes obedience, care in old age, and honoring ancestors.

discovery.text: Confucius taught that family order creates social order. If children respect parents, citizens will respect rulers.

twist.text: Critics say filial piety silences the young and empowers the old. It can become a tool of control, not love.

climax.text: Filial piety still shapes East Asia. Its power shows that family, not the individual, is society's real building block.

punchline.text: Family first. Confucius made parental devotion civilization's foundation.

quiz.question: What is filial piety?
options: Devotion and obedience to one's parents
